name: Anti-Intellectual Revolution
description: After this agenda resolves: Each player exhausts each planet they control that has a technology specialty.

name: Archived Secret
description: Elected player draws 1 secret objective.

name: Arms Reduction
description: Each player destroys all but 2 of their non-fighter ships in each system.

name: Articles of War
description: All units lose the BOMBARDMENT ability.

name: Classified Document Leaks
description: When this agenda is revealed, the speaker draws the top 2 cards of the secret objective deck. One is placed face up as a public objective; the other is discarded.

name: Colonial Redistribution
description: Each player places 1 infantry from their reinforcements on each non-home planet they control.

name: Committee Formation
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, they may, during the agenda phase, discard this card to cast 5 additional votes.

name: Compensated Disarmament
description: Destroy each unit that has BOMBARDMENT that is in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system. Each player who had a unit destroyed gains 3 trade goods.

name: Conventions of War
description: Players cannot use BOMBARDMENT against units that are on a planet that contains a structure.

name: Core Mining
description: Elect a non-home, non-Mecatol Rex hazardous planet. Attach this card to that planet. The resource value of that planet is increased by 2.

name: Demilitarized Zone
description: All units in the Mecatol Rex system that are not controlled by the player who controls Mecatol Rex are destroyed. No player may produce units in, move units to, or place units in the Mecatol Rex system.

name: Economic Equality
description: Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply. Then, each player gains 5 trade goods.

name: Enforced Travel Ban
description: Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.

name: Executive Sanctions
description: Each player can have a maximum of 3 action cards in their hand.

name: Fleet Regulations
description: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.

name: Galactic Crisis
description: Each player that has 1 or more victory points discards all action cards from their hand.

name: Holy Planet of Ixth
description: Elect a cultural planet. Attach this card to that planet. The influence value of that planet is increased by 2.

name: Homeland Defense Act
description: Each player can have a maximum of 1 PDS on each planet they control.

name: Imperial Arbiter
description: The current speaker gains this card. While a player has this card, they may discard it after an agenda is revealed to look at the top 3 cards of the agenda deck. They choose 1 to reveal as the current agenda and place the others on the bottom of the deck.

name: Incentive Program
description: Draw and reveal the top 3 cards from the stage I public objective deck. Choose 1 to place face up in the common play area. Discard the others.

name: Ixthian Artifact
description: The speaker rolls 1 die. On a result of 6-10, each player may research 1 technology without spending resources. On a result of 1-5, destroy all non-fighter ships in the galaxy.

name: Judicial Abolishment
description: Each law that is in play is discarded.

name: Minister of Commerce
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, at the start of each Strategy Phase, that player gains 1 trade good for each non-home planet they control.

name: Minister of Exploration
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, they gain 1 commodity whenever they explore a planet.

name: Minister of Industry
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, they may use the PRODUCTION ability of each of their space docks one additional time during each of their turns.

name: Minister of Peace
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, after another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of this player's units, that player gains 1 trade good.

name: Minister of Policy
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, at the end of the Status Phase, that player draws 1 additional action card.

name: Minister of Sciences
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, when they research a technology, they may ignore 1 prerequisite.

name: Minister of War
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, each of their units rolls 1 additional die during space combat.

name: Miscount Disclosed
description: The speaker draws 1 secret objective. Each other player may draw 1 secret objective.

name: Mutiny
description: Each player who voted 'For' gains 1 victory point. Each player who voted 'Against' loses 1 victory point.

name: New Constitution
description: Each law in play is discarded. Players cannot play action cards during the Agenda Phase for the remainder of this round.

name: Political Censure
description: Elect a player. That player cannot play action cards. If this agenda is discarded, return this card to the agenda deck.

name: Prophecy of Ixth
description: Elect a player. That player gains 1 victory point. Then, if that player has the most victory points, each other player gains 1 trade good.

name: Public Execution
description: Elect a player. That player discards all action cards from their hand.

name: Publicize Weapon Schematics
description: If any player owns a war sun, that player destroys all of their war suns. Then, each other player may research the War Sun unit upgrade technology for free.

name: Regulated Conscription
description: When a player uses PRODUCTION, the maximum combined cost of units they produce is limited to their space dock's PRODUCTION value.

name: Representative Government
description: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the Agenda Phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead.

name: Research Team: Biotic
description: Elect a non-home planet that has a biotic technology specialty. Attach this card to that planet. The planet's technology specialty counts as an additional biotic prerequisite when researching technology.

name: Research Team: Cybernetic
description: Elect a non-home planet that has a cybernetic technology specialty. Attach this card to that planet. The planet's technology specialty counts as an additional cybernetic prerequisite when researching technology.

name: Research Team: Propulsion
description: Elect a non-home planet that has a propulsion technology specialty. Attach this card to that planet. The planet's technology specialty counts as an additional propulsion prerequisite when researching technology.

name: Research Team: Warfare
description: Elect a non-home planet that has a warfare technology specialty. Attach this card to that planet. The planet's technology specialty counts as an additional warfare prerequisite when researching technology.

name: Seed of an Empire
description: The player with the most victory points gains 1 victory point. If there is a tie, no player gains a victory point.

name: Senate Sanctuary
description: The player who controls Mecatol Rex cannot be the target of action cards. No player may produce units in the Mecatol Rex system.

name: Shared Research
description: Each player who owns the fewest technologies may research 1 technology without spending resources, ignoring prerequisites.

name: Swords to Plowshares
description: Each player destroys half of their infantry on each planet they control, rounded up. Then, each player gains trade goods equal to the number of infantry they destroyed.

name: Terraforming Initiative
description: Elect a non-home, non-Mecatol Rex hazardous planet. Attach this card to that planet. The resource value and influence value of that planet are each increased by 1.

name: The Crown of Emphidia
description: Elect a player. That player gains this card. While a player has this card, they gain 1 victory point. When a player gains this card, they gain 1 commodity for each cultural planet they control.

name: Unconventional Measures
description: Each player draws 2 action cards.

name: Wormhole Reconstruction
description: All systems that contain a wormhole are adjacent to each other.

name: Wormhole Research
description: Each player who has 1 or more ships in a system that contains a wormhole may research 1 technology. That technology must have a prerequisite of the same type as a wormhole in that system.

name: Galactic Employment
description: Each player gains 1 trade good for each planet they control that has a technology specialty.
